blogs.title: Do You Want to Know the Difference Between Alloy & Steel Wheels?
blogs.content:
##  Which one is better for my car?

There are commonly two types of wheels found in modern cars:

1.  Steel wheel

2.  Alloy wheel.

Each one has its own advantages and disadvantages. They vary in different parameters which are given below:

-   Maintenance, 

-   Reliability, and

-   Aesthetics, etc. 

Let us understand the difference between alloy wheels and Steel wheels and which type of wheel will be better for your car?

### What are alloy wheels?

Alloy is a combination of several metals. They are usually made from an alloy of either magnesium or aluminum. Alloys have wonderful qualities like malleability, rigidity, durability, etc. Consequently, they are generally used. Alloy wheels are highly light in weight and costly as compared to steel wheels.

Alloy Wheels have some benefits which are mentioned below:

##### Advantages of alloy wheels

-   Due to light weight, alloy wheels permit better vehicle taking care of.

-   Fully suited for sports cars, and ultra-high performance cars.

-   The splendid aesthetic appearance of alloy wheels also increases its demand. 

-   You can customize alloy wheels in terms of looks, polishing, finishing, and painting.

##### Disadvantages of alloy wheels

-   Alloy wheels are not long-lasting. When driven on irregular terrains or massive ruts there is a possibility to bend and crack.

-   If alloy wheels are cracked and damaged in case they cannot be repaired.

-   Alloy wheels are expensive as compared to steel wheels.

-   Alloy wheels are corrosion resistant.

### What are steel wheels?

Steel wheels are made from stamped steel and have been used on vehicles for a very long time. In a manufacturing process, steel is being pressed and after that suitably welding them into shape. They are highly recommended for being tough and durable. Steel wheels are mostly found on tourist cars, SUVs, HMVs, etc. We can also say steel wheels are more flexible for off-road and heavy-duty cars. At the end, they are stronger than alloy wheels and less expensive to purchase.

##### Advantages of steel wheels

-   Steel wheels give higher strength and durability.

-   They are budget-friendly and easy to repair.

-   They have more capacity to absorb shocks.

##### Disadvantages of steel wheels

-   These wheels are heavy as compared to alloy wheels.

-   In steel wheels, there is a lack of customization which leads to a lower aesthetic appearance.

-   Steel wheels are less fuel-efficient.

Which one is better for you, alloy wheels or steel wheels? It depends on your type of car. You can also visit near tyre expert shop. It will support you in making your final decision by knowing your requirements.

blogs.title: Speed Index And Load Rating Index – What Does This Mean?
blogs.content:
In this blog, we are discussing what is a Speed And Load Rating Index?

In the tyre sidewall, it contains information like the width of tyre, aspect ratio, load rating or index, speed index etc. This data is passed on in alphanumeric configuration.

Want to know how to read the exact size of the tyre? Here is an example:

The tyre markings 175/70 R 14 84T indicate:

-   Tyre width - 175 mm

-   Aspect ratio - 70

-   Tyre construction - R (R for radial tyre)

-   Rim size - 14 inches

-   Load index - 84

-   Speed rating -- T

Important Things You Need to Know About Tyre Load Index

The load index on the tyre symbolizes the highest load the tyre can convey at maximum safe inflation. 

Then the load index is converted into kilograms just to know about the load the tyre can maintain. If you want to know the load index, check out the above example. In this example, the load index 84 corresponds to 500 kilograms. This indicates when the tyre is raised to its maximum safe pressure it can carry 500 kilograms. The absolute amount of load index in kilograms for all 4 tyres of your car is the greatest amount of load your car can handle. Overloading enhances the chances of tyre wear, decreases vehicle stability, increases fuel consumption, etc.

blogs.title: Why Choosing the Best Quality Car Tyre is Important?
blogs.content:
Tyres are a crucial part of the vehicle. All the tyres that you see stocked up in a tyre store can look all good. The tyres that you see in a tyre store can look identical but it does not mean they perform the same job. There 

could be a huge variation in the design of these tyres.

At first look, the tread pattern of every new tyre might look impressive.

 But these tyres are made from different tread patterns, compounds, and ingredients.

Premium tyre manufacturer spends a lot of time to develop a perfect tyre for wet, dry, hot and cold conditions. It assures your tyre will do specifically what it is supposed to do in all driving conditions. 

This is how low-cost tyres should not be used.

In our country, here we are experiencing three to four months of rain every year, the design of the tyre tread is not just about styling. Tyres play an important role in wet conditions to maintain your car under control. Using the right quality of the tyres is important for safety purposes. If tyres don't cut through the surface of the water then your vehicle will end up hydroplaning. It means tyres of your car will surf on top of the water and you will no longer be connected to the road and you will not be able to stop the car. Therefore when it comes to wet driving, the best quality tyres can make all the difference.

Important Factors that give the best quality tyres an edge over the rest are:

Superior Braking -- Branded tyres made of premium elastic produce a ton of grip. They are suitably connected to the surface of the road. Thus, the halting distance is substantially less. It also helps to increase the braking power for safety purposes.

Cornering Performance -- A major distinction is experienced during cornering. Inferior quality tyres don't deliver sufficient grip and skid off the corner. This is because their capacity to adhere to the road is far less as compared to premium quality tyres.

Higher grade elastic. 

It helps to handle better and overall driving performance.

Increased life span of Tyre The top-notch rubber compounds and other polymers along with the cutting-edge engineering technology used in manufacturing the tyre result into the longer existence of the tyres. 

So, always choose your tyres carefully. Top tyre manufacturer uses the most advanced technology, making it the brand of decision for enduring, reliable tyres in India. blogs.title: Spoke Wheels vs Alloy Wheels – Which one is better and Why?
blogs.content:
## Spoke Wheels:

Spokes are common in all cars, trucks, bicycles, and motorcycles. Wheels usually have chrome spokes on them. Spokes are the Rods spreading from the hub to attach to the rim. 

Spoke wheels are more durable than alloy wheels. Due to this reason, motorcycle manufacturers prefer spoke wheels instead of alloy wheels.

_Spoke wheels are mainly used in_

-   Enduros,

-   ADVs,

-   Scramblers,

-   Off-road, and dirt bikes.

Read further to know the advantages and disadvantages of spoke and alloy wheels.

#### Advantage of Spoke Wheels:

Spoke wheels offer the highest level of flexibility and durability. Due to this reason, they are able to handle the pressure to a specific degree. By using these types of wheels, you will be able to drive your car through rough terrains or massive ruts. Spoke wheels have a good ability to absorb shocks.

The other advantage of using spoke wheels is that they can be repaired easily as compared to alloy wheels. Because of their aesthetic value, most of the bike manufacturers and customers preferred them.

Spoke wheels are less expensive than alloy wheels.

#### Disadvantages of Spoke Wheels:

Spoke wheel bikes use inner tubes. It creates complexity while fixing punctures and exchanging the tubes. It is because the whole wheel assembly must be taken off while making maintenance or alteration. Fixing a broken or a loose spoke is also a time-consuming process.

Spokes are attached to the steel rim that why they cannot be customized.

## Alloy wheels:

Alloy is a combination of several metals. They are usually made from an alloy of either magnesium or aluminum. Alloys have wonderful qualities like malleability, rigidity, durability, etc. Consequently, they are generally used. Alloy wheels are highly light in weight and costly as compared to steel wheels.

Alloy wheels are light-weighted, affordable, easy to assemble, freedom of customization and they allow cars to use tubeless tyres.  Alloy wheels are more affordable and rigid.

#### Advantages of Alloy Wheels:

- They are highly rigid and thus can sustain an increased amount of torque and horsepower with ease.

- Alloy wheels offer more stability.

- Puncture repairs or tyre changes are easy and simple in alloy wheels.

#### Disadvantages of Alloy Wheels:

There is a lack of flexibility in alloy wheels. When hit hard by huge rocks at high speed they crack or dent. In such situations, alloy wheels cannot be repaired. It needs to be replaced.

blogs.author: fefe
blogs.title: Important Things You Need to Know What Goes Into Your Car AC Service.
blogs.subtitle: 7 Min read
blogs.content:
Summer is here and boy it's staying put. Be your everyday office drive or an end-of-the-week escape, travelling without AC will be terrible. Given that the temperature inside the car lodge can ascend to 60°C, determining the status of your vehicle AC ought to be your first concern. There can be a large group of issues creeping up like low cooling, smell, failed compressor, and many more. That's why regular AC maintenance is necessary to keep the cooling at maximum efficiency.

#### Do you want to know how Car AC works?

### Car Automotive Air Conditioning Service Explained:

In this blog, we are describing how Car AC works and what goes inside AC servicing. You can also learn more about vital AC components, common AC issues and how you can maintain your Car AC at home.

###  Components of Car AC

- ##### Compressor

    Only the Compressor is responsible for pressing the refrigerant gas, which is known as Freon. We can also say the compressor works like a pump. After the compression of gas, it becomes hot and transmitted through a condenser. Compressor plays a vital role in the working of Car AC.

- ##### Refrigerant

    Refrigerant is also one of the important components of Car AC. It is basically a fluid contained within the coils of a car AC system. Before 1993, R-12 a.k.a Freon refrigerant is used. Later, it replaces with Freon because it harmed the environment.

- ##### Condenser

    A condenser is a series of coils. It helps to remove the heat from the compressed gas. The condenser acts as a heat exchanger and helps to cool the refrigerant by changing the state from gas to liquid form.

- ##### Evaporator

    The evaporator is another crucial component of Car AC. If you need cold and refresh air, it plays an important role. Usually, it is located inside the car. But sometimes you can also find an evaporator just right behind the dashboard. 

- ##### Thermal Expansion Valve

    The thermal expansion valve works in tandem with the evaporator. It helps to controls the pressure of the AC refrigerant. Thermal Expansion Valve or Orifice Tube monitors the quantity of pressure and temperature of the Car A/C system.

- ##### Dryer/Accumulator

    It contains a desiccant and responsible for pulling away moisture.

###  9+ Top Reasons that your Car AC isn't cooling Enough

#### Car AC Service Fully Explained:

Are you looking for car ac servicing? When you take your car for a car air conditioning repair, the mechanic starts by checking the cabin temperature. The temperature should be approximately 5°C-10°C. After checking this, the technician then proceeds to check the level of the refrigerant present in the system.

In case if the refrigerant level drops it highly affects the AC's ability to cool. 

It is one of the common reasons why your car AC isn't working properly. By using a pressure gauge and a precision AC gas recharging machine, they flush the refrigerant out and best it up to the suggested level.

While working on this, car mechanic also check leakage or cracks in the AC line and hoses..

If there is an apparent leak it could be because of a bad seal and bearing. Then the compressor starts making a buzzing noise. One of the best ways to keep a compressor working well is to be checked regulary and serviced. Also, you can replace the compressor oil for the maintenance of the compressor.

After that technician comes the compressor, which is the most valuable component in a car AC system. In case if the the compressor malfunctions, the whole AC system will fail. 

The condenser, which lives before the motor is checked for twisted/harmed balances or an obstructed line. A condenser becomes stopped up because of leaves, residue and flotsam and jetsam develop. It can likewise truly cut down the cooling productivity of the AC. In case such is the situation, the condenser is washed with gentle water pressure to not twist the balances. 

Besides, they likewise check whether the dryer is appropriately working. They likewise do a last investigation of the evaporator for any dampness develop. The dampness develop isn't uplifting news. This is on the grounds that the water content can saturate indispensable electrical segments under the dashboard. 

At long last, they clean the lodge channel or the HVAC channel (warming, ventilation, cooling) situated under the glove box. After each 15,000km, the channel is supplanted.

### 5 Common Car AC Problems 

- ##### Car AC not cooling enough

    This can be because of a low refrigerant level or a failed compressor, which can be very costly to fix. Another reason for this is, something as simple as a stopped-up condenser. If the condenser becomes clogged it minimizes the surface area of the coil and this outcome in less cooling.

- ##### Bad odor from the AC

    A weak or solid foul smell would highlight shape/buildup or moisture formation in the AC filter. Cleaning or supplanting the filter generally takes care of the issue. Yet, on the off chance that you smell "spoiled eggs" while working the AC, We stringently suggest you ought to get a professional technician to handle this.

- ##### Loud whirring noise

    Loud high-pitched buzzing noise while operating the AC can be due to a shot compressor bearing. In case, if the sound is coming from inside the cabin, the blower fan assembly should be repaired or replaced.

- ##### Water seeping inside the cabin

    If you notice water inside the car cabin, this is because of outside becomes blocked.

- ##### Engine overheating

    Actually like the steering or the water pump, the compressor utilizes some power from the engine. The clutch on the compressor can hold onto making the compressor put a superfluous burden. This in the long run overheats the engine.

_If you are looking to repair car air conditioning at home, here are a few steps:_

- ##### Wipe the vents

    Dust on the car AC vent can eventually accumulate. You need to clean it. You can remove the dust by using a brush or a sponge. Gently clean the AC vent every once in a while otherwise it causes a drop in cooling.

- ##### Clean the cabin filter

    You need to clean the dirty cabin filter or the HVAC filter regularly. This filter is located just behind the glove box. It can lead to foul odor while the AC operates. You can easily clean the filter with a brush.

- ##### Clean the condenser

    As we already discussed, the condenser is located behind the front bumper of the car. You can clean it with a high-pressure jet washer and chemical chemicals.

If you're a responsible car owner, make sure to service your car AC regularly to maintain cooling efficiency. The servicing of the car AC is unavoidable.

If you need the Best Car AC Services in Noida, CarPlus is here to assist you. We are a full car AC service provider company at the best prices in your city.

Services offered by us:

-   AC Gas Recharge

-   AC Condenser Cleaning

-   AC Cooling Coil/Evaporator Cleaning

-   AC Filter Service

-   AC Diagnosis & Inspection

-   AC Vents & Dashboard Cleaning

blogs.author: fefe
blogs.title: Why is Choosing the Best Quality Car Tyre one of the most Important aspects?
blogs.subtitle: 3 Min read
blogs.content:
Tyres are incredibly complex products. All the tyres that you see stocked up in a tyre store can look all good. But, just because they look alike does not mean they do the same job. There could be a big difference in the design of these tyres. At the first glance, the tread pattern of every new tyre might look convincing. Unfortunately, what you don't see is what that construction is made from, what is underneath the tread pattern, the compounds and the ingredients that have been used . That's where a premium manufacturer spends millions every year to develop a tyre that's perfect for wet, dry, hot and cold conditions. This ensures your tyre will do exactly what it is supposed to do in all driving conditions. While that is not the case with a low quality tyre. It might be ok in dry conditions but might not be completely ok in wet conditions. This is also explains the low cost of such tyres.

In a country like India where we experience almost 3 to 4 months of rain every year, the design of the tyre tread is not just about styling. It plays a crucial role in keeping your car under control in wet conditions. If your tyres don't cut through the surface of water effectively your car will end up hydroplaning. Which means your tyres will surf on top of the water and you will no longer be connected to the road and will be unable to stop or steer. Hence, especially when it comes to wet driving, the right quality tyres can make all the difference.

##### Factors that give premium high quality tyres an edge over the rest are:

- Superior Braking --  Branded tyres made of premium rubber generate a lot of grip and are well connected to the surface of the road. As a result, the stopping distance is much less.

- Cornering Performance -- A big difference is experienced during cornering. Low quality tyres don't produce enough grip and skid off the corner. This is because their ability to stick to the road is far less as compared to premium tyres.

- Higher grade rubber.

- Better handling and overall driving performance.

- Increased life span -  The high quality rubber compounds and other polymers along with the cutting-edge engineering technology used in manufacturing the tyre results into longer life of the tyres.

So, choose your tyres wisely. Top tyre manufacturer like Michelin uses the latest technology, making it the brand of choice for long lasting, reliable tyres in India. If you are concerned about the performance of your tyres then why not check out some best quality tyres and seek advice from one of the professional [tyre dealers near you](https://www.tyres-n-services.in/dealers).

The first thing that must be done to determine car mechanics is qualified, licensed, and certified. Everyone loves the car and is passionate about engines. Choosing unprofessional and inexperienced mechanics for a car repair can lead to more problems later. So if you're looking to hire a mechanic, ask about his or her credentials.

You can also some questions like:

-   How long have they been doing business?

-   Where did they go to school, or who did they train under?
